overview:
## Overview

Use this class to receive live depth, water pressure, and water temperature data on Apple Watch Ultra.

Start by assigning a usage description using the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/BundleResources/Information-Property-List/NSMotionUsageDescription] key in your app target’s information property list. You also need to include an entitlement to access the live submersion data.

To access data for dives with a maximum depth of 6 m, add the Shallow Depth and Pressure capability to your app. For more information, see [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Xcode/adding-capabilities-to-your-app].

To enable a maximum depth of 40 m, you must apply for the full Submerged Depth and Pressure entitlement. For more information, see [https://developer.apple.com/contact/request/submerged-depth-pressure-api/].

Next, check whether submersion data is available.

If the [doc://com.apple.coremotion/documentation/CoreMotion/CMWaterSubmersionManager/waterSubmersionAvailable] property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], instantiate a [doc://com.apple.coremotion/documentation/CoreMotion/CMWaterSubmersionManager] object and assign a delegate.

Your delegate then begins receiving updates from the system. For more information, see [doc://com.apple.coremotion/documentation/CoreMotion/accessing-submersion-data].

crawled: 2025-12-06T08:08:00Z

# CMWaterSubmersionManager

**Class**

An object for managing the collection of pressure and temperature data during submersion.

## Declaration

```swift
class CMWaterSubmersionManager
```

## Overview

Use this class to receive live depth, water pressure, and water temperature data on Apple Watch Ultra.

Start by assigning a usage description using the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/BundleResources/Information-Property-List/NSMotionUsageDescription] key in your app target’s information property list. You also need to include an entitlement to access the live submersion data.

To access data for dives with a maximum depth of 6 m, add the Shallow Depth and Pressure capability to your app. For more information, see [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Xcode/adding-capabilities-to-your-app].

To enable a maximum depth of 40 m, you must apply for the full Submerged Depth and Pressure entitlement. For more information, see [https://developer.apple.com/contact/request/submerged-depth-pressure-api/].



Next, check whether submersion data is available.

```swift
guard CMWaterSubmersionManager.waterSubmersionAvailable else {
    return false
}
```

If the [doc://com.apple.coremotion/documentation/CoreMotion/CMWaterSubmersionManager/waterSubmersionAvailable] property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], instantiate a [doc://com.apple.coremotion/documentation/CoreMotion/CMWaterSubmersionManager] object and assign a delegate.

```swift
// Instantiate the submersion manager.
submersionManager = CMWaterSubmersionManager()


// Assign the submersion manager delegate.
submersionManager.delegate = self
```

Your delegate then begins receiving updates from the system. For more information, see [doc://com.apple.coremotion/documentation/CoreMotion/accessing-submersion-data].

## Setting the delegate

- **delegate**: The object that receives updates about submersion data and events.

## Checking availability and authorization

- **waterSubmersionAvailable**: A Boolean value indicating whether the current device supports the submersion manager.
- **authorizationStatus**: A value indicating whether the app has user authorization to receive submersion data.

## Accessing the maximum depth

- **maximumDepth**: The maximum depth supported by the water submersion manager.

## Water submersion

- **Accessing submersion data**: Use a water-submersion manager to receive water pressure, temperature, and depth data on Apple Watch Ultra.
- **CMWaterSubmersionManagerDelegate**: A delegate that receives updates about ambient pressure, water pressure, water temperature, and submersion events.
- **CMWaterSubmersionEvent**: An event indicating that the device’s submersion state has changed.
- **CMWaterSubmersionMeasurement**: An update that contains data about the pressure and depth.
- **CMWaterTemperature**: An update that contains data about the water temperature.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
